DOC.brief_summary: The overall aim study test hypothesis vibration exercise induce high normal bone strain strain rate experience habitual locomotor activity . The investigator plan study healthy young volunteer : 1 . Determine relationship tibial bone strain - frequency amplitude vibration therapy - range habitual locomotor activity ; 2 . Determine transmission vibration vibration therapy , term - amplitude attenuation phase shift positional coordinate acceleration anatomic landmark along low leg skeletal sit - relationship different frequency amplitudes vibration therapy ; 3 . Determine muscle power lower limb associate various habitual locomotor activity relationship measure tibial bone strain . The investigator subsequently hope use data capture experiment develop QCT-based finite element ( FE ) model human low limb ( tibia , fibula foot ) . The investigator validate model relation characteristic ( amplitude phase shift ) measure tibial bone strain transmission vibration different anatomical landmark vibration therapy .
DOC.brief_title: Does Vibration Therapy Induce Higher Than Normal Bone Strains Strain Rates Than Those Experienced During Habitual Daily Activities
DOC.criteria: Male female volunteer , age 18 50 year Generally healthy , determined review medical history physical exam Ambulatory Willing physically able undergo study procedure BMD ( measure DXA ) lumbar spine hip within Â± 2 SD young normal range BMI < 30 Previous diagnosis osteoporosis History fracture spine , pelvis , leg foot History bone joint disorder affect shoulder , spine , pelvis , legs foot ( e.g . arthritis , congenital hip dislocation , spinal spondylolisthesis ) Ongoing condition diseases know cause secondary osteoporosis Malabsorption syndrome ( e.g . coeliac Crohn 's disease ) Known disorder calcium metabolism Known history thyroid disease Osteomalacia Paget 's disease Diabetes History cancer within previous 5 year Epilepsy Ongoing condition use medication may impair vision balance Use follow medication within previous 2 year Bisphosphonates Fluoride ( except use oral hygiene ) Strontium Teriparatide Other bone agent ( e.g . SERMs , isoflavones , HRT , calcitonin etc ) Steroids Alcohol abuse illicit drug use Pregnancy currently try conceive ( woman ) Inability give informed consent Known hypersensitivity antibiotic penicillin cephalosporin Known hypersensitivity local anaesthetic lignocaine .
